message:
SYSTEM: Terminology_in_ontologies.pdf: Página 27
27
What is an ontology?
• “An ontology is similar to a dictionary or glossary, but 
with greater detail and structure that enables computers 
to process its content. (IEEE Standard Upper Ontology 
Working Group)
• “An ontology consists of a set of concepts, axioms, 
and relationships that describe a domain of interest.”
SUMO ontology http://ontology.teknowledge.com/
speaker: SYSTEM
